entity_name: Clerk of the House of Representatives, All Staff Employees
summary: The documents provided focus on the payroll records of various staff members of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). These records, including payroll authorization forms and related memoranda, detail the employment history, salary adjustments, and position changes of individuals like Sheila Jackson Lee, Richard A. Sprague, Thomas Howarth, James Lerer Wolf, and Belford L. Lawson III. The documents span from 1976 to 1979, covering the period when the HSCA was actively investigating the JFK assassination. The Clerk of the House of Representatives is implicitly involved as the office responsible for managing and processing the payroll for all House employees, including those working for the HSCA. The documents highlight the administrative aspects of staffing the HSCA and provide a glimpse into the individuals involved in the investigation.
significance: The Clerk of the House of Representatives, through the payroll records of HSCA staff, indirectly contributes to the historical record of the JFK assassination investigation. While not directly involved in the investigative work, the administrative function of managing staff payroll is essential for the operation of the HSCA. The payroll records themselves provide a verifiable account of who worked for the committee, their roles, and the duration of their service, offering a glimpse into the organizational structure and staffing of the HSCA during its investigation.
